title: Nice Cyrillic sans serif font
content:
Does anybody have an idea what is this font?  
I only have this Cyrillic example, but I bet there is a Latin version too.

Thanks in advance!

Font: 

 Bravo Font 

Solved By: 

 [DPape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033/http:/typophile.com/user/3945 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [croppedimage785300-Bugarski-Film-2014-Cover.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033/http:/typophile.com/files/croppedimage785300-Bugarski-Film-2014-Cover.jpg) | 23.79 KB |
author: Aurelius

comments.content:
I didn't find a Cyrillic exact match. Here are some similar fonts. All of the fonts include Latin characters.  
Standard CT Cond Reg

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StandardCTCondReg_Cyr_6635.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/standard/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/standard/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/standard/")  
FF Good Headline Pro Comp News  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FFGoodHeadlineProCompNews_Cyr_3629.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/good-headline-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/good-headline-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/good-headline-pro/")  
DIN Condensed Light  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DINCondensedLight_Cyr_4778.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/")  
FF DIN Pro Cond  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FFDINProCond_Cyr_3691.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/")  
Don

As DPape said. Just trim the Д.
